External: jQuery.fn

jQuery.fn

mzDropDownTree is a jQuery plugin used to create a dropdown tree structure with html5 detail and summary tags. It is a lightweight powerful plugin which can be used to either create nested checkbox list from either static or remote data source.
Author:
  • Mishraz Bhounr
Source:
  • mzdropdownlist.plugin.js, line 3
See:
  • The mzDropDownTree

Methods

(static) mzDropDownTree()

main callback to render a tree div from options object
Source:
  • mzdropdownlist.plugin.js, line 10
Examples

Initialize basic tree.

<div id="your-tree-id"></div>
<script>
$("#your-tree-id").mzDropDownTree({options})
</script>

Initialize basic tree with data attributes.

<div id="your-tree-id" data-label="Label" data-description="Description of the tree"></div>
<script>
$("#your-tree-id").mzDropDownTree({options})
</script>

declaring the static data property for the tree

  defaultOptions.data = {
      label:"Label of the option"
      value: "12345"
      children:{
      {
          label:"Label",
          value:"Value"
      },
      {
          label:"Label",
          value:"Value"
          children:[
              {
                  label:"Label",
                  value:"value"
              }
          ]

      } 
  }
}

Declaring remote data property.

-NOTE: That the remote data property must return a numeric childcount
returned data from URL source must include child count
{
  label:"Label"
  value: "value"
  children: 10|0|1
}
tree node is fetched again when the tree node is expanded.

defaultOptions.data{
  url:"URL TO YOUR SOURCE"
  method: "[POST|GET]" default is GET
  data: data 
}
